page.title: 06FARMING MEDIA BURY FARM
page.content: Our class 1RI went in the mini-bus to Bury Farm Caddington owned by Mr Mossman. There are about 30 horses and a number of carriages which are used for films, videos, weddings, funerals and special events. The farm is for storing and looking after the animals, carriages, coaches and horse drawn buses. The fields are for grazing and hay making. There are about 8 cattle on the farm to keep down the grass. We met two minature horses called Mork and Mindy, another had been in a video for Frankie goes to Hollywood and a film called Little Lord Fauntleroy. Many of the horses were away from the farm making the film Revolution. There was a Royal Mail coach and an old bus. In the old days the ladies would sit downstairs because the stairs were very narrow and ladies dresses were wide.
